field.name: summary
field.value: Sort attribute for collections is ignored

field.name: description
field.value:
From the NH 1.2 documentation about sort attribute: Allowed values of the sort attribute are unsorted, natural and the name of a class implementing System.Collections.IComparer.
So I tried it with a class that implemented IComparer in AR:
[HasMany(typeof (Order), Table = "Orders", ColumnKey = "ID", Inverse = true, Sort = "ARTester.Domain.Utilities.Comparer, ARTester", Cascade = ManyRelationCascadeEnum.AllDeleteOrphan)] public IList<Order> Orders { get { return _orders; } set { _orders = value; } }
The resulting Mapping file (part of it) looked like this (the sort attribute is missing):
<bag name="Orders" access="property" table="Orders" lazy="false" inverse="true" cascade="all-delete-orphan"> <key column="ID" /> <one-to-many class="ARTester.Domain.Order, ARTester" /> </bag>
